metadata.Title: CVE-2023-5633 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high.
metadata.Description:
The reference count changes made as part of the CVE-2023-33951 and CVE-2023-33952 fixes exposed a use-after-free flaw in the way memory objects were handled when they were being used to store a surface. When running inside a VMware guest with 3D acceleration enabled, a local, unprivileged user could potentially use this flaw to escalate their privileges. Murray McAllister discovered that the VMware Virtual GPU DRM driver in the Linux kernel did not properly handle memory objects when storing surfaces, leading to a use-after-free vulnerability. A local attacker in a guest VM could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5633` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-13-generic - 6.5.0-13.13
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-13-generic - 6.5.0-13.13
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-13-generic-64k - 6.5.0-13.13
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-aws - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1006-laptop - 6.5.0-1006.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-13-lowlatency - 6.5.0-13.13.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-13-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-13.13.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1012-oracle - 6.5.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1007-raspi - 6.5.0-1007.9
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-13-generic - 6.5.0-13.13
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-13-generic - 6.5.0-13.13
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-13-generic-64k - 6.5.0-13.13
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-aws - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-13-lowlatency - 6.5.0-13.13.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-13-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-13.13.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1012-oracle - 6.5.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1004-starfive - 6.5.0-1004.5
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Murray McAllister of NCC Group APAC

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-13.13').
linux-aws package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1010.10').
linux-azure package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in mantic is affected and needs fixing.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
